description: Activities and societies: GIANT Campus, IEEE SCSS.

A study around bio-inspired environment perception for autonomous machines and robots. Research about novel brain-inspired computing paradigms for advanced computer vision and self localization in space, along with hardware implementation of a neuromorphic integrated circuit for direct and efficient operation in image sensors.
Supervision of 3 Internships and successful Lead of 1 Master's Thesis in bio-inspired computer vision.
Semester 3 - Focus on digital electronics, HDL, and circuit design and implementation.

degree: M.Eng. in Micro and Nanotechnologies for Integrated Systems
description: Semester 2 - Focus on analog electronics, and fabrication and characterization of nanoscale devices.

degree: M.Eng. in Micro and Nanotechnologies for Integrated Systems
description: Semester 1 - Focus on foundational knowledge in physical processes, MEMS, and semiconductor physics.
Activities and societies: Treasurer in the Club Oenologie de Grenoble INP - Preparation of the CANSAT competition - Drummer in the music band "La Boutique Rouge".
